problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which type of radiation has no mass or charge and is highly penetrating?
problems.detailed: Gamma radiation (\(\ce{\gamma}\)) is an electromagnetic wave with no mass or charge and is highly penetrating.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: In alpha decay, how are the atomic number and mass number of the nucleus changed?
options: Atomic number decreases by 2, mass number decreases by 4
Atomic number increases by 2, mass number increases by 4
Atomic number decreases by 1, mass number unchanged
Atomic number unchanged, mass number decreases by 2
problems.detailed: Alpha decay emits an alpha particle (\(\ce{^4_2He}\)), so atomic number decreases by 2 and mass number decreases by 4.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What is the relationship between half-life \(T_{1/2}\) and the decay constant \(\lambda\)?
problems.hint: Half-life is how long until half decays.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which decay process converts a neutron into a proton and emits a beta-minus particle?
problems.detailed: In beta-minus decay, a neutron in the nucleus becomes a proton, emitting a beta-minus particle (electron) and an antineutrino.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What happens to the activity \(A\) of a radioactive sample over time according to the decay law?
problems.hint: Follows the same pattern as number of nuclei decaying.
problems.detailed: The activity \(A\) decreases exponentially over time following \(A = A_0 e^{-\lambda t}\), matching the decay of number of nuclei.
